TITLE.P: KIOS 046/17 — Supply of a Real Time Digital Simulator

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Contract Scope is to develop an advanced power systems testbed with real time capabilities for simulating power grids and abilities for hardware in the loop investigations. The power system testbed must consist of a Real Time Digital Simulator with ability of real-time simulations of power grid up to 160 3-phase buses (in EMT simulations), all the necessary equipment (i.e., digital and analogue input / output cards, rapid control prototype control board, and linear 3-phase power amplifier) for enabling Hardware In the Loop (HIL) investigations. Installation, technical support, and training services related to the prior-mentioned equipment need to be included in this contract.

MAIN_SITE.P: The place of delivery of the products under supply is KIOS Research and Innovation Center of Excellence — Building SFC03, 1 Panepistimiou Avenue 2109 Aglantzia, Nicosia, Cyprus.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Contract Scope is to develop an advanced power systems testbed with real time capabilities for simulating power grids and abilities for hardware in the loop investigations. The power system testbed must consist of a Real Time Digital Simulator with ability of real-time simulations of power grid up to 160 3-phase buses (in EMT simulations), all the necessary equipment (i.e., digital and analogue input / output cards, rapid control prototype control board, and linear 3-phase power amplifier) for enabling Hardware In the Loop (HIL) investigations. Installation, technical support, and training services related to the prior-mentioned equipment need to be included in this contract.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: The choice for purchasing the OPAL-RT solution (consisting of a real-time simulator along with the corresponding input / output cards and the linear power amplifier) is based on the following unique technical characteristics:

— the simulator can run simulations in real-time emulating the operation of large-scale modern power systems based on both electromagnetic transient (EMT) and phasor (RMS) models using different solver periods. The RMS models can be used for simulation of large-scale power grids with up to 1000 3-phase buses, while the EMT simulations allow the accurate representation of the dynamic characteristics of machines and the ultra-fast characteristics of power electronics (using a solver period of 50 us and 1 us respectively),

— the solution allows performing Control Hardware In the Loop (Control-HIL) studies in the area of power systems. The solution is equipped with digital communication boards to allow the real-time interaction with the simulated power systems. Thus, measurements and control signals can be exchanged between the simulator and any external controller in a synchronized way to test monitoring / control methods for power systems using Control HIL framework,

— the solution allows to perform Power Hardware In the Loop (Power HIL) investigations. The combination of the real-time simulator for power systems along with the dedicated fast input / output cards and the linear power amplifier allows the physical representation of an emulated 3-phase electrical node in terms of voltage and current. Thus, physical power equipment (i.e., PV system) can be connected to the amplifier to perform investigations for the interaction between the real-time emulated power system and the physical power equipment using Power HIL framework,

— the models for the real-time simulator of power systems can be developed using MATLAB / Simulink. The compatibility of the simulator with MATLAB / Simulink libraries is essential since the University of Cyprus researchers are already trained in this software and there are several power systems models already developed in Simulink,
— the solution can be straightforwardly expanded by purchasing / activating additional CPU cores,
— training seminars will be provided within the University of Cyprus premises,
— technical support within Europe is provided for this solution.
Detailed information about the justification of this procedure, can be found in the (approved) Form of the Competition.
